translation.en: I've never met a world champion that's a normal person.
translation.ko: 제가 만난 월드 챔피언 중에 평범한 사람은 없었어요

translation.en: You gotta be screwed up in some manner
to get out of bed to do extraordinary things.
And I'm screwed up.
Underneath this veneer of being a normal, nice guy,
translation.ko: 평범하고 착해 보이지만 "존 버트런드 호주 선장" 그 안에는 엄청난 자존심이 자리하고 있어요

translation.en: I have a huge ego.
translation.ko: 그 안에는 엄청난 자존심이 자리하고 있어요

translation.en: There's gotta be some motivation to drive someone to extraordinary lengths.
translation.ko: 비범한 일을 행하려면 그만한 원동력이 있어야 하는데

translation.en: And the ego is part of my drive.
[announcer] Good morning, the world.
We're lining up now for the start
of the seventh and vital race in this America's Cup.
translation.ko: 아메리카 컵의 마지막을 장식할 7차전을 위해 두 팀이 이동 중입니다

translation.en: Yachting's big event is more historic
than the Kentucky Derby, the World Series or the Super Bowl.
translation.ko: 켄터키 더비, 월드 시리즈 슈퍼볼보다도 유구합니다

translation.en: And for the first time in 132 years, America may lose the America's Cup.
translation.ko: 132년 만에 처음으로 미국 팀이 패배의 위기에 처한 듯합니다

translation.en: Now, the whole point of this was to win the America's Cup,
which no one had ever done before.
It was the longest winning streak in history of sport.
translation.ko: 스포츠 역사에 둘도 없는 최장 연승 기록이에요

translation.en: The United States having successfully defended the Cup
for 132 years, since before the US Civil War.
translation.ko: 내어준 적이 없어요 남북전쟁을 겪는 동안에도요

translation.en: [reporter] This country's domination has outlasted the Confederacy,
translation.ko: 미국의 요트 패권은 아메리카 연합국과 나치 독일

translation.en: the Third Reich, and the St. Louis Browns.
Now the Australians think their time finally has come.
translation.ko: 그러나 호주 선수들은 새 시대를 직감하고 있습니다

translation.en: Today they sail the winner-take-all, do-or-die, there's-no-tomorrow race.
translation.ko: 오늘 필사적인 두 팀 선수들은 승자독식의 경기를 펼칩니다

translation.en: Billed as the race of the century-- The greatest yacht race of the century.
translation.ko: - 세기의 레이스로 불리며… - 20세기를 장식할 요트 경기죠

translation.en: The bottom line is the New York Yacht Club
were not in the business of losing the America's Cup.
translation.ko: 트로피를 내놓을 생각이 추호도 없었다는 겁니다

translation.en: [Bertrand] So we had no confusion.
translation.ko: 그래서 우린 한 치의 망설임 없이

translation.en: We were at war.
The full-scale war is already underway.
The Australians claim they're the target of a dirty-tricks campaign
translation.ko: 호주 팀은 간첩 활동과 정치적 모략이 동반된

translation.en: involving espionage and political backstabbing.
translation.ko: 비열한 방해 공작의 희생양이 됐다고 주장합니다

translation.en: We now have the FBI involved, spies, armed guards.
translation.ko: FBI, 스파이, 무장 경비까지 투입된 상황입니다

translation.en: [man] The New York Yacht Club are absolutely determined
translation.ko: 뉴욕 요트 클럽은 미국이 아닌 나라에

translation.en: to do everything possible to ensure
that the Cup stays here in the United States.
To take on the United States was a huge psychological mountain.
translation.ko: 미국을 상대한다는 것만으로 심리적 부담이 엄청났어요

translation.en: The most powerful nation technically and economically in the world…
translation.ko: 미국은 기술, 경제 분야에서 세계 최강국이었습니다

translation.en: -[camera shutter clicks] -[Bertrand] …and a little country…
with 27 million people called Australia…
…had the audacity to think that we could do it.
The first America's Cup that I'd heard was the 1962 America's Cup.
translation.ko: 제가 처음으로 지켜본 대회는 1962 아메리카 컵이었어요

translation.en: Australia versus United States.
translation.ko: 호주와 미국의 대결이었는데 "1962 아메리카 컵 로드아일랜드 뉴포트"

translation.en: How this country was tuned into this event halfway around the world.
translation.ko: 지구 반대편에서 벌어지는 일에 전 국민이 귀를 기울였죠

translation.en: [news anchor] These races have captured the imagination of millions.
translation.ko: 수백만의 상상력을 자극한 이 경기를 보기 위해

translation.en: The President of the United States himself
abandons the cares of Washington to attend.
The Australians, if they win, see it as an opportunity
translation.ko: 호주가 승리한다면 잘 알려지지 않은 그들의 존재를

translation.en: to project their little-known country onto the international stage.
translation.ko: 국제 무대에서 널리 알릴 좋은 기회가 될 것입니다

translation.en: I can… I can still hear it.
[reporter 1] Winds 20 to 25 knots and seas choppy…
[Bertrand] I was just a little boy listening on the wireless.
I was seven years old listening to a small transistor radio,
translation.ko: 7살이었는데 한밤중에 작은 트랜지스터라디오를 들고 "롭 브라운 호주 선수"

translation.en: lying in bed in the middle of the night.
A little tiny transistor radio.
Like a little transistor radio.
My mother said, "You get a good night's sleep,"
and I'm trying to listen to the radio.
translation.ko: "스킵 리시먼 호주 선수" 저는 라디오만 듣고 있었어요

translation.en: [reporter 2] …all over the eastern seaboard flock to the waters of Newport, Rhode Island.
translation.ko: 동부 해안 전역에서 뉴포트를 향해 모여듭니다

translation.en: [Lissiman] Three in the morning,
12 hours different time zone in Newport, Rhode Island.
[commentator] This is Newport, the home of the America's Cup yacht race.
Since the turn of the century,
it's been the holiday playground of the nation's super rich.
translation.ko: 미국 재력가들의 휴가철 피서지로 애용된 곳이죠

translation.en: As a little boy, I was infatuated with the incredible history.
translation.ko: 어렸을 땐 아메리카 컵의 장대한 역사에 매료됐었어요

translation.en: All these incredible characters.
[commentator] And when the summer breezes begin to roll in across the sound,
translation.ko: 여름과 함께 찾아온 산들바람이 해협 안까지 불어오면

translation.en: their minds turn to the only game in town, yacht racing.
translation.ko: 유일한 스포츠인 요트 경주에 방문객들의 관심이 쏠립니다

translation.en: [Bertrand] For me to skipper an America's Cup boat,
that set my imagination into another direction.
translation.ko: 그 꿈같은 생각이 제 상상력을 자극했어요

translation.en: It was like the door opening to another world.
translation.ko: 다른 세계로 가는 문이 열린 것만 같았죠

translation.en: There are some people at Internal Revenue
who think yachting is not much more than a dubious tax deduction.
translation.ko: 요트를 수상쩍은 세금 공제 수단으로만 보지만

translation.en: The America's Cup, however, is something else again.
translation.ko: 아메리카 컵을 보면 생각이 바뀔 겁니다

translation.en: The America's Cup's always been the top echelon of the sport of sailing.
translation.ko: 아메리카 컵은 언제나 요트 대회의 최고봉이었어요

translation.en: [Bertrand] The America's Cup is one boat versus one boat,
one country versus one country.
The best of seven races.
First boat to win four races wins the America's Cup.
translation.ko: "아메리카 컵 코스" 4회 먼저 이기는 팀이 대회에서 우승하는 구조죠

translation.en: It's one-on-one. It's like a duel to the death.
translation.ko: 일대일 싸움입니다 죽을 때까지 싸우는 거예요

translation.en: [announcer] Look at it go down! This is yachting's answer to the Titanic.
[man] They basically have a desire to beat each other's brains out,
translation.ko: 상대의 두뇌를 꺾겠다는 강한 의지로 임하는 거죠

translation.en: but it's a lot better than going to war or shooting it out in the streets.
[Bertrand] The unique element of the America's Cup
is you're given a shot every four years, just like the Olympics.
It's a huge commitment, both physically and psychologically.
[Longley] The rules were any country could challenge for the America's Cup,
translation.ko: 어느 국가든 챔피언에게 도전할 수 있지만

translation.en: but you had to design the boat in the country you were challenging from.
You had to build the boat in that country as well.
[Bertrand] So these projects need money.
Lots of money.
[reporter] The super-rich have brought large bank accounts, millions of dollars.
translation.ko: 재력가들이 투자한 거금은 수백만 달러에 달합니다

translation.en: In the case of the America's Cup,
we're talking high-cost, high-tech yacht racing.
[Bertrand] Unlike any other sport,
the US had never lost.
♪ And it sounds so real… ♪
[Lissiman] It was the longest winning streak in sporting history
translation.ko: 스포츠 역사를 통틀어 가장 긴 연승 기록이에요

translation.en: where the New York Yacht Club had successfully defended the Cup
translation.ko: "미국, 아메리카 컵을 지키다" 뉴욕 요트 클럽은 132년 동안 로드아일랜드 뉴포트에서

translation.en: in Newport, Rhode Island, for 132 years.
translation.ko: 뉴욕 요트 클럽은 132년 동안 로드아일랜드 뉴포트에서 우승 트로피를 지켜내 왔죠

translation.en: [Bertrand] There was a sense of arrogance by the New York Yacht Club.
translation.ko: 뉴욕 요트 클럽의 거만함을 느낄 수 있었어요

translation.en: This is our patch.
You can play with the patch and then we'll bid you farewell.
[reporter 1] The New York Yacht Club have defended this Cup
against all-comers from around the world
with such complete sailing mastery
that it's a wonder anyone comes after it at all.
translation.ko: 도전하는 팀이 있는 게 놀라울 따름입니다

translation.en: [reporter 2] The New York Yacht Club on Manhattan's West 44th Street.
translation.ko: "뉴욕 요트 클럽 뉴욕시" 맨해튼 웨스트 44번가에 위치한 뉴욕 요트 클럽입니다

translation.en: With its windows carved in the manner of a 17th century Dutch yacht,
translation.ko: 17세기 네덜란드 선박을 연상케 하는 창문 뒤에는

translation.en: this is the center of the yachting universe.
The exclusive preserve
of some of America's wealthiest and most influential men.
translation.ko: 가장 영향력 있는 자들만을 위한 전유물이죠

translation.en: The New York Yacht club were ferocious defenders of the America's Cup.
translation.ko: 뉴욕 요트 클럽은 트로피를 맹렬히 지켜내던 팀이었어요

translation.en: [Lissiman] They reeked of old American money,
Vanderbilts and Roosevelts.
So there was a huge amount of mystique.
[Longley] And there was something about the American boats.
translation.ko: 또 미국 요트는 왠지 모르게 특별했어요

translation.en: They had this aura about them. They were immaculate.
Their sails always looked like they were carved out of alabaster.
They oozed style, wealth.
Oozed this unbeatableness.
And one day, way back in 1970,
we go into the New York Yacht Club.
[Simmer] And there was a room,
it was this kind of octagonal room where the Cup was sitting.
translation.ko: 팔각형 모양의 방에는 트로피가 진열돼 있었죠

translation.en: [Bertrand] We spoke to the curator, and he said, "You realize, John,
that that trophy had not been touched by human flesh for a hundred years."
translation.ko: '이 트로피에는 무려 100년 동안 사람의 살갗이 닿지 않았습니다'

translation.en: I looked at this trophy and I thought, "My God, John, this is it."
translation.ko: 트로피를 보는 순간 생각했어요 '그래, 바로 이거야'

translation.en: Perfect, shiny silver.
The Holy Grail.
[reporter] This is the family jewel.
Silver under glass.
This is what the Americans are spending $45 million on this year alone.
translation.ko: 이 트로피를 지키기 위해 올해만 4,500만 달러가 투입됐습니다

translation.en: Now, legend has it that the first American skipper to end up losing this Cup
translation.ko: 전설에 따르면 이 트로피를 잃는 미국 팀 선장은

translation.en: will end up losing his head.
[Bertrand] There's no question the emerging force
for the New York Yacht Club was Dennis Conner.
A native of San Diego, California, folks, please welcome Dennis Conner.
He was the might and focus of the New York Yacht Club.
translation.ko: 뉴욕 요트 클럽의 중심이자 핵심 인물이었습니다

translation.en: And he took the America's Cup
from an amateur world to a professional world.
Dennis changed the game.
But isn't it true that you've taken a sport
that was, uh, previously considered kind of what wealthy guys did on weekends,
translation.ko: 기존에는 부자들의 취미로만 여겨졌던 요트 대회를

translation.en: and turned it into more like stock car racing?
Dennis was the best. He was the best.
Ah, he's brilliant, absolutely brilliant.
I think it's fair to say Dennis was a different person.
One of these skippers who will do anything to win.
translation.ko: 우승을 위해서라면 모든 것을 바칠 선장이에요

translation.en: [Conner] If the most important thing in the world
translation.ko: 데니스 코너와 함께 아메리카 컵에서 우승하는 게

translation.en: was winning the America's Cup and sailing with Dennis Conner,
translation.ko: 데니스 코너와 함께 아메리카 컵에서 우승하는 게 세상에서 가장 중요하면

translation.en: over going to church, over your job, over your wife, your kids…
translation.ko: 교회도, 직장도 아내와 자녀들도 뒷전이 돼요

translation.en: "Oh, I gotta take off for two weeks to go skiing."
translation.ko: '2주간 스키나 타러 가볼까?' "데니스 코너 미국 선장"

translation.en: Well, enjoy your skiing, but don't bother coming back.
translation.ko: 가는 건 자기 맘이지만 다신 만날 일 없어지는 거죠

translation.en: [Bertrand] The first time I raced against Dennis was 1974, the America's Cup.
translation.ko: 처음 데니스와 맞붙은 건 1974 아메리카 컵 때였어요

translation.en: And we had no chance.
The Australians, they weren't in the America's Cup business.
Psychologically, you have to perform at a very high level.
You got down to the boat early
and checked the weather, tide, current, sailing instructions,
translation.ko: 날씨, 조수, 물살 항해 지침을 확인하고

translation.en: got your boat in the water, made sure it was smooth and clean,
getting out to the course and checking the wind,
current, and the race committee and getting instructions,
translation.ko: 코스를 달리며 바람과 파도를 살피고 주최 측 지시 사항은 물론 풍향도 체크해야 하죠

translation.en: and checking the wind before the start, which way it was shifting.
translation.ko: 주최 측 지시 사항은 물론 풍향도 체크해야 하죠

translation.en: You had the right sails, the right mast.
You'd practiced. Your crew weighed the right amount.
translation.ko: 훈련을 거듭하고 선수들 체중까지 맞춰야 해요

translation.en: If you did all those things, every time, you would then have no excuse to lose.
translation.ko: 매번 그 절차를 따랐다면 패배해도 변명할 여지가 없어요

translation.en: Lambs to the slaughter each time. Hammered in '74.
[Tom Brokaw] Dennis Conner came through for America again today,
translation.ko: 오늘도 데니스 코너는 미국을 위해 해냈습니다

translation.en: winning the race by more than a minute and a half.
Got hammered again in '77.
[reporter 1] The experts said it'd be 4 and 0,
and they've done in the Australians four races to zero.
translation.ko: 미국은 4 대 0으로 호주 팀을 압도했습니다 "실망한 호주"

translation.en: Went back again in 1980, got beaten again.
[reporter 2] And Australia simply couldn't catch up
and has now failed in three attempts to win the America's Cup.
translation.ko: 이로써 아메리카 컵에서 세 번 패배한 셈입니다

translation.en: [Conner] I won 38 straight races.
I was the best sailor in the world.
I slaughtered them.
Welcome back to Turpie Tonight.
Ah! What a cue!
I want you to listen carefully to this.
In September 1983,
someone will be challenging the Americans for the America's Cup,
translation.ko: 호주 선수들이 아메리카 컵에 도전할 겁니다

translation.en: and this man will be skipper.
Ladies and gentlemen, would you please welcome John Bertrand?
[Bertrand] Deep down, I knew if there's anyone that can actually take on Dennis Conner,
translation.ko: 마음속 깊이 직감하고 있었어요 데니스 코너를 꺾을 사람은

translation.en: it was someone like myself.
[host] How long have you been sailing?
I started when I was 12 years old.
-[host] What type or class of yacht? -Little Sabots, little trainers.
translation.ko: 어떤 종류의 배였죠? - 작은 연습용 딩기였어요 - 그래요?

translation.en: [Bertrand] My great-grandfather was involved in the construction
translation.ko: 제 증조부는 아메리카 컵 요트 건조 작업에

translation.en: of three America's Cup boats.
My grandfather was a professional fisherman,
and he'd teach me when the sea breeze would come in.
He'd have this intuitive sixth sense that was passed on to myself.
translation.ko: 할아버지가 가진 직감을 제가 물려받은 거죠

translation.en: [host] No makeup. Is that what you get from life on the ocean waves?
translation.ko: 바다에서 지내면 그렇게 잘 그을린 피부를 가질 수 있나요?

translation.en: It's hours in the sun, Ian.
Hours and hours.
Is this a hard life?
[Bertrand] But when I was 15, there was a shock to our family.
translation.ko: 하지만 제가 15살 때 집안에 풍파가 찾아왔어요

translation.en: My father died,
my grandfather died,
and then my great-grandfather died, in sequence.
So we lost all the men.
[woman] When John's father passed away, there was a call in him.
translation.ko: 존은 아버지를 여의면서 운명의 부름을 받았어요

translation.en: It, in fact, was what has always driven him.
But what I really understood about John was his ability to really focus.
translation.ko: 하지만 제가 아는 존의 핵심은 "레이사 버트런드 아내" 바로 집중하는 능력이에요

translation.en: He could totally shut off.
I was infatuated with winning the America's Cup
translation.ko: 아메리카 컵 우승과 그에 요구되는 일에만

translation.en: and what was required.
Hopefully, you'll be the one to challenge whatever yacht the Americans put up.
translation.ko: 존이 미국에 도전장을 내밀게 됐으면 좋겠네요

translation.en: That's right. Dennis Conner is the skipper of the one boat,
translation.ko: 그렇습니다, 데니스 코너가 미국 팀 선장인데

translation.en: which he successfully defended last time.
translation.ko: 지난 대회 때도 우리를 꺾은 사람이죠

translation.en: -Didn't like him much. -[audience laughs]
[Bertrand] Every year losing to Dennis,
I concluded that I wasn't mentally tough enough.
And unless you understood your competition,
unless you understood the enemy, you could never actually take it to another level.
translation.ko: 적을 알지 못하면 그 위로 올라설 수 없습니다

translation.en: So I got a scholarship to MIT in Boston
in the Department of Ocean Engineering to become part of the US system.
translation.ko: 보스턴 MIT 해양공학과에 "매사추세츠 공과 대학교" 장학생으로 입학했어요

translation.en: [man] During this program, you'll be training for careers in marine engineering.
translation.ko: 여러분은 본 과정을 통해 해양공학 관련 직업을 준비하고

translation.en: There will be lab work, sea projects, and plenty of difficult classwork.
translation.ko: 해양 연구 및 프로젝트 등의 어려운 과제를 학습할 겁니다

translation.en: [Rasa] When he told me the name of his thesis,
I think, by then, I really understood
how important sailing was to him.
Optimum Angle of Attack of America's Cup Sails.
Using lifting-line theory, aerospace engineering,
highly technical control systems,
basically torpedoes.
I was behind enemy lines for months…
learning about secrets.
That was very applicable to the America's Cup challenge.
translation.ko: 아메리카 컵 도전에 도움이 될 만한 비밀들을요

translation.en: So, after MIT, I knew enough
that we could go head-to-head, toe-to-toe with the best in the world.
translation.ko: 세계 최고 팀과 맞붙을 만큼 충분한 지식이 쌓여 있었죠

translation.en: [man] Come on, Kyle.
[Conner] To compete, you have to have the money. I just said,
"When you want to race the America's Cup, show me the money."
translation.ko: 아메리카 컵에 나가고 싶다면 돈부터 마련해야 하죠

translation.en: I guess it's fair to say that estimates about how much money has been spent to win this baby
translation.ko: 이 아름다운 트로피를 손에 넣기 위해서

translation.en: are anywhere between 60 and maybe 100 million dollars.
[Conner] I was lucky.
I had the backing of the New York Yacht Club.
I loved them like Mom and Dad.
So you get the money, then you can start to put a team together.
translation.ko: 돈이 마련되면 그때부터 팀을 꾸릴 수 있어요

translation.en: [reporter] Conner is putting his troops through a training program
translation.ko: 코너가 팀을 위해 준비한 훈련 프로그램은

translation.en: as tough as any yet devised for an America's Cup campaign.
translation.ko: 아메리카 컵 역사상 가장 험한 난이도를 자랑합니다

translation.en: [Conner] It's important that the crew be able to perform at their best,
translation.ko: 중요한 건 선수들이 최고의 실력을 발휘하는 건데

translation.en: and to do so, they have to have a full commitment,
working 5:00 in the morning till 9:00 at night, six days a week for 17 months.
So the more money, you can start to invest in technology.
translation.ko: 돈이 많이 모였다면 기술에 투자할 수 있어요

translation.en: Then you can start thinking about, "What kind of a designer are we going to have?"
"Who's gonna build the boat? Who's gonna make the sails?"
[host] The New York Yacht Club calls to order the first meeting…
translation.ko: 뉴욕 요트 클럽이 주관하는 첫 모임입니다

translation.en: [Bertrand] Studying the New York Yacht Club,
I realize if we're ever to win this thing,
we would need money, lots of money.
translation.ko: 돈이 필요하다는 걸 알았어요 아주 많이요

translation.en: [reporter] The story of the America's challenge
translation.ko: 아메리카 컵 도전기는 "앨런 본드 호주 팀 소유주"

translation.en: is the story of the whole Bond financial saga.
Bondy has always been a gambler,
and that's what this is all about, money.
[Bertrand] Alan was the syndicate chairman for Australia.
He took a gamble.
It was his money. It was his project.
[Simmer] Bondy was a big risk-taker. Larger than life.
He'd made a lot of money in a short amount of time,
translation.ko: 큰돈을 짧은 시간 안에 벌어들인 사람이에요

translation.en: largely through property deals.
And he bought Swan Brewery.
But from the New York Yacht Club's point of view, he wasn't real wealth.
translation.ko: 하지만 뉴욕 요트 클럽에선 부자 축에도 못 끼었어요

translation.en: [Bertrand] Alan intuitively knew
to win could take him from a local trader to a global trader.
translation.ko: 이 대회에서 우승하면 세계로 뻗어 나갈 수 있다고요

translation.en: It was power and influence, and that was his motivation.
[Bertrand] So, I said to Alan,
"There's basically three elements in this competition."
"You gotta have world-class administration."
"You gotta have world-class technology,
and, ultimately, the team has to be world-class."
We needed to get brilliant, highly sophisticated minds.
Invite the best of the best.
So I called Huey.
[Treharne] Got an apprenticeship and I left school as a sailmaker.
translation.ko: "휴 트리한 전술가" 전 돛 제작 견습생이 되어서 학교를 관뒀어요

translation.en: I can see wind shifts and wind pressure. Just could almost smell the wind.
translation.ko: 풍향과 풍압이 눈에 보여요 냄새도 맡을 정도죠

translation.en: [reporter] …and outstanding tactician Hugh Treharne
join other senior members of the Australian team.
translation.ko: 발군의 선수들이 소속된 호주 팀에 합류했습니다

translation.en: Is this the year of the impossible?
I was working as an engineer on a uranium mine.
translation.ko: 전 우라늄 광산에서 엔지니어로 일하고 있었습니다

translation.en: I was actually a school teacher at the time.
I was working as an electrical engineer.
And I get a phone call out of the blue saying,
translation.ko: 그런데 어느 날 갑자기 전화 한 통을 받았어요

translation.en: "I'd like you to be the navigator
on this 12 Metre we're gonna build for the next America's Cup."
I hadn't been a navigator on any boat.
He said, "You're an engineer. You go and figure it out."
[Lissiman] John Bertrand very carefully worked out the people with the right mental capacity,
translation.ko: 존 버트런드는 뉴욕 요트 클럽을 상대할 정신력을 지닌 인물들을

translation.en: who could outsmart the New York Yacht Club.
[Bertrand] To take on the power of the American psyche,
with their immense confidence,
you need a strong ego to be able to play that game,
and that was a major hurdle.
[Bertrand] In our country, in Australia,
we have this thing called the Tall Poppy Syndrome,
where people start to show a sense of confidence, and they cut you down.
translation.ko: "키 큰 양귀비 증후군" 사람이 자신감을 보이기 시작하면 바로 잘라버린다는 뜻이에요

translation.en: So, if I could get the mental side tough enough,
translation.ko: 그런 부분을 보완해 강한 정신력으로 단련하면

translation.en: then perhaps I could put the whole thing together.
[Lissiman] Bertrand sent this psych test out to all of the potential crew members.
translation.ko: 버트런드는 모든 선수들에게 정신 감정을 받게 했는데

translation.en: And I can remember getting this 14-page psych test
and thinking, "What is this crap?"
translation.ko: 14쪽짜리 시험지를 들고 당황했던 기억이 나요 '이깟 게 다 뭐야?'

translation.en: Yeah. I did the personality test. [laughs]
The assessment was that I could have more confidence.
That was the assessment, yeah, that I could have more confidence.
So for us, we had to believe ourselves that we belong on the world stage.
translation.ko: 세계 무대에 오를 자격이 있다고 스스로 믿음을 가져야 했어요

translation.en: That's the power of visualization.
See the sails, see fellow crew members,
realize the trust, faith, and respect you have for them.
translation.ko: 동료를 향한 신뢰와 믿음 존경을 느껴보세요

translation.en: You're visualizing the environment even before you've gone into battle.
translation.ko: 전투에 나가기도 전에 전장을 떠올리는 거죠

translation.en: Ultimately, training the mind not to be intimidated in that environment.
translation.ko: 그 환경에서 위축되지 않도록 정신을 훈련시키는 거예요

translation.en: [man] Listen to the helicopters above.
-[helicopter blades whirring] -[man] You see the US Coast Guard.
We're all working hand in hand together as a team.
And then you see Dennis Conner…
and his American boat, Liberty.
[Bertrand] And finally, the last thing we had to have was the high-tech, world-class boat.
translation.ko: 마지막으로 필요한 준비물은 세계 정상급의 최첨단 요트였어요

translation.en: But the American sailing technology was at a much higher level
translation.ko: 하지만 당시 미국의 항해 기술은 호주에 비해 월등히 앞서 있었죠

translation.en: than anything we had in Australia.
[reporter] The battle of the Cup has become a war of technology,
translation.ko: "1982년 아메리카 컵 13개월 전" 아메리카 컵은 기술의 전쟁이 되었습니다

translation.en: and Conner had wanted to build himself a fearsome weapon.
translation.ko: 코너는 무시무시한 무기를 만들고 싶어 했죠

translation.en: So he went to the heavily-guarded US Government weapons research center.
translation.ko: 그래서 삼엄한 경비를 자랑하는 정부 무기 연구소로 향했습니다

translation.en: [Conner] Right now we have naval architects involved.
As a matter of fact, we have, at the hub of our campaign,
basically a subcontractor from the Department of Defense.
translation.ko: 우리 팀의 핵심적인 준비 과정에 참여하고 있는 것이죠

translation.en: Dennis had US Navy and aerospace technology.
translation.ko: 데니스 편에는 미 해군과 항공 우주 기술이 있었어요

translation.en: [Simmer] And he had big design teams, like nearly 30 guys,
but those days we just had Benny.
We had Benny. That was it.
[reporter] Seen here is the barefoot Australian, Ben Lexcen.
translation.ko: 맨발의 호주인 벤 렉슨을 보고 계십니다

translation.en: He's Alan Bond's unlikely choice to design his yacht
for the upcoming 1983 America's Cup.
But where many designers live in a world full of calculus and geometry,
translation.ko: 그러나 설계자 대부분이 미적분과 기하학에 빠져 살 동안

translation.en: Ben Lexcen lives in a world of art.
[Lexcen] Yacht design is still an art.
It's probably one of the only arts left where the artist has to prove his work
by actual performance.
Benny was different.
He was not constrained in a box.
Brilliant and dangerous in so many ways.
translation.ko: 여러 면에서 뛰어나고 위험하기도 했어요 "벤 렉슨 요트 디자이너"

translation.en: He was the Leonardo da Vinci of Australia.
Only three years of formal education, nine years old to twelve years old.
So he wasn't restricted in his thinking.
That was his strength, as it turns out.
[Longley] Ben's one of these really unique people in the world
who comes from an incredible background of hardly any formal schooling at all.
translation.ko: 학교를 거의 다니지 않았다는 독특한 배경을 가지고 있죠

translation.en: He was almost a street person in a way.
[Rasa] Benny would just arrive and stay with us for two nights, two weeks,
translation.ko: 베니는 우리 집에서 이틀 내지 2주간 머무르곤 했는데

translation.en: and he was physically very awkward.
He had a very severe tic, but he was curious.
translation.ko: 틱 증상도 심했죠 그런데 호기심이 대단하더군요

translation.en: He was a passionately curious man.
And we've moved the rig slightly, so, uh… The boat feels really nice.
translation.ko: 삭구 위치를 살짝 조정했는데 느낌이 아주 좋네요

translation.en: [Longley] His genius was to be able to absorb information.
translation.ko: 모든 정보를 흡수하는 천재적인 면모를 지녔어요

translation.en: He's like a honeyeater.
He'd just pick, pick, pick, pick, pick, pick, pick, pick and bring all this in.
translation.ko: 이것도 빨고, 저것도 빨고 전부 흡수하곤 했죠

translation.en: [Bertrand] So when Benny started to design the yacht,
I was sitting on the dock, and he said, "John, look at the seagulls."
translation.ko: 부두에 앉아있는 제게 그러더군요 '존, 저 갈매기를 보세요'

translation.en: He said, "Every feather, there's a flight control system."
translation.ko: '깃털 하나하나에 비행 제어 장치가 들어 있어요'

translation.en: He said, "There must be a thousand control systems
in one wing of that bird."
He said, "Look at how they take off. It's just one flip and they're gone."
translation.ko: '이륙하는 모습을 봐요 날갯짓 한 번이면 충분하잖아요'

translation.en: "It's beautiful."
He was a student of nature.
And I had very little understanding of where it could lead,
translation.ko: 베니가 어떤 작품을 창조할지 가늠되진 않았지만

translation.en: but the door was opened.
[Longley] Benny had gone across to Holland to try and design a 12 Metre
translation.ko: 베니는 1980년 요트보다 더 좋은 12m 요트를 만들기 위해

translation.en: that was gonna be better than the 12 Metre that we had in 1980.
[Bertrand] Benny was at one of the biggest towing tank facilities in the world
translation.ko: "네덜란드 선박 모형 정박지" 세계 최대 규모의 예인 수조 시설에 가서

translation.en: trying to get another one hundredth of one knot out of the boat.
He was tearing his hair out trying to find an improvement, and he just couldn't.
translation.ko: 머리를 이리저리 굴려봤지만 기록은 나아지지 않았죠

translation.en: [Longley] He was enormously frustrated,
and suddenly we started getting these telexes…
where he said, "Hang on. We're onto something here."
Every day we'd get back to the office and there'd be another telex
translation.ko: 매일 사무실에 나가면 베니의 텔렉스가 와 있었는데

translation.en: with him getting more and more excited.
He said, "I'm developing a keel here that could potentially be a breakthrough."
translation.ko: '용골을 개발 중인데 돌파구가 될지도 몰라요' "오스트레일리아 2호 날개형 용골"

translation.en: But he didn't actually tell us what it was.
translation.ko: "용골 - 요트 균형을 잡아주는 구조적 요소" 어떤 건지는 말하지 않았어요

translation.en: [reporter] Lexcen's seven models underwent test trials in minute detail in at least 200 runs,
translation.ko: 렉슨의 일곱 모형은 200회 이상의 정밀 테스트를 거쳤으며

translation.en: which allowed the designer to make constant refinements to his secret keel.
translation.ko: 비밀리에 제작 중인 용골은 수정을 거듭했습니다

translation.en: [Bertrand] So the call came through to come across to see this model
translation.ko: 결국 전화가 왔는데 재밌는 모양의 용골을 가진 모형을 보러 오라고 하더군요

translation.en: that he created with this funny-looking keel.
translation.ko: 재밌는 모양의 용골을 가진 모형을 보러 오라고 하더군요

translation.en: [Simmer] So, I knew there was something special going on with the keel.
translation.ko: 평범한 용골이 아니란 걸 직감하고 있었어요

translation.en: Benny said, "Okay, you can come over, but you can't tell anyone."
translation.ko: 베니가 그랬죠, '와도 되는데 절대 비밀로 해야 돼요'

translation.en: It was under covers, and John Bertrand took me in to have a look.
translation.ko: 장막에 덮여 있었고 존 버트런드가 구경하자며 데리고 들어갔는데…

translation.en: There, sitting in the foundry on the sand, was this thing.
translation.ko: 건조장 모래밭 위에 그 배가 올라가 있었어요

translation.en: [Brown] And I think I was speechless.
Just trying to take it all in.
I'm looking at this thing going, "You can't be serious."
translation.ko: 그 배를 보는 순간 생각했죠 '농담하는 거지?'

translation.en: I didn't know what to think because it looked a bit weird.
[Longley] People have been designing 12 Metres since 1905.
This is so different.
How can it be right?
I knew that the keel was inverted.
It was upside down.
It was like someone designed a new car. Looked like it's got wheels on the roof.
translation.ko: 바퀴가 지붕에 달린 자동차를 보는 기분이었어요

translation.en: It became clear Benny had been playing around with wings.
translation.ko: 베니가 날개를 연구했다는 걸 한눈에 알 수 있었죠

translation.en: It's like a bird with wings on it. Okay?
And that became the outrageous winged keel.
translation.ko: 그게 그 유명한 날개형 용골의 탄생이었죠

translation.en: [Simmer] We knew the boat was high risk.
And John, who's technically one of the great sailors,
translation.ko: "장점: 기동성 풍속 10노트 이상 시 빠름" "단점: 저항 증가 저풍속에서 느림" 항해 실력으로는 둘째가라면 서러운 존조차도

translation.en: was a little nervous about it.
The last thing I wanted to do
is to spend a huge amount of my time, effort, and emotion
translation.ko: 엄청난 시간과 노력 염원이 들어갔기 때문에

translation.en: on something where the equipment was never gonna cut it.
translation.ko: 이길 수 없는 요트로 참가할 수는 없었어요

translation.en: We didn't even know it was gonna sail like a yacht.
When I showed our boat, they all thought I'd gone off my rocker.
translation.ko: 제가 만든 요트를 보여줬더니 다들 미친 줄 알더라고요

translation.en: So we decided we were going to have a big meeting with Alan Bond.
translation.ko: 그래서 앨런 본드를 불러서 중대 회의를 진행했어요

translation.en: "So, Alan, Benny's come up with a boat that is very, very different."
"But the tank says it's 20 minutes faster around the track than this one."
"What are we going to do?" And Alan said, "Right."
"Well, we're gonna build that one. Otherwise, you're all fired."
So we just went ahead and built that boat.
This is where Ben Lexcen's latest winged wonder
translation.ko: 이곳 노스프리맨틀에 있는 용해된 납 통 안에서

translation.en: will have its fiery birth in a vat of molten lead in North Fremantle.
translation.ko: 벤 렉슨의 날개 달린 불가사의가 뜨거운 탄생을 맞을 겁니다

translation.en: [Simmer] So many years of getting hammered by the Americans.
It was time that we had to do something radical.
Skippy and I were involved in building the boat.
translation.ko: 저도 스킵과 같이 요트 제작에 합류했어요

translation.en: You know, literally hands-on.
Everyone was covered in gray from grinding and cutting aluminum.
translation.ko: 알루미늄 가루 때문에 모두 회색으로 덮여 있었어요

translation.en: [Longley] Benny Lexcen and I designed the deck layout together.
translation.ko: 전 베니 렉슨과 함께 갑판 구조를 설계했고…

translation.en: And I was in charge of everything from the deck up.
We actually threw the rule book out in terms of how sails will be made.
translation.ko: 그동안 알고 있던 돛 제작술은 전부 잊어버렸어요

translation.en: And we developed the software to design the sails.
translation.ko: 그리고 돛을 만들어 줄 독자적인 소프트웨어를 개발했죠

translation.en: Totally revolutionary.
[Simmer] We would take risks and broke a lot of stuff
translation.ko: 도전적인 제작 방식 때문에 부품이 부러지는 일도 많았어요

translation.en: because Benny was experimenting as he was building stuff.
translation.ko: 베니는 배를 만드는 와중에도 실험을 반복했으니까요

translation.en: That's how he was, you know.
[Bertrand] You'd say, "Well, that guy's crazy."
Well, yes, he was, but we're all crazy. It's all part of the deal.
translation.ko: 맞아요, 우리 모두 다 미쳤죠 미치광이들만 모았으니까요

translation.en: [reporter 1] We sat down with designer Ben Lexcen
translation.ko: 디자이너 벤 렉슨과 함께 팀 소유주 앨런 본드에 대해

translation.en: and talked about his partnership with team owner Alan Bond.
translation.ko: 디자이너 벤 렉슨과 함께 팀 소유주 앨런 본드에 대해 인터뷰를 나눠봤습니다

translation.en: [Lexcen] I'm not under any pressure of time or money,
translation.ko: 시간이나 돈에 대해 부담을 주지도 않고

translation.en: and he appreciates my style of thinking,
and he more or less lets me just wander along like I'm an inventor.
translation.ko: 제가 발명가인 것처럼 제멋대로 굴게 해주죠

translation.en: Alan Bond's new 12 Metre was officially named in the ceremony
translation.ko: 오늘 퍼스에 모인 수천 명의 관중 앞에서 본드가 만든 12m 요트의 명명식이 진행됐습니다

translation.en: before thousands of spectators in Perth today.
[reporter 2] A supremely confident Alan Bond
translation.ko: "가라, 오스트레일리아 2호" 자신감에 가득 찬 앨런 본드는 오늘 기자회견을 통해

translation.en: told a news conference today
translation.ko: 자신감에 가득 찬 앨런 본드는 오늘 기자회견을 통해

translation.en: that Australia II would win the America's Cup.
The construction of this yacht first began with Ben Lexcen, the designer.
translation.ko: 오스트레일리아 2호의 제작은 벤 렉슨 디자이너가 시작했습니다

translation.en: We've worked over two years on a truly Australian effort.
translation.ko: 2년에 걸쳐 호주인의 위상에 걸맞은 노력이 들어갔죠

translation.en: For the first time,
we have been able to develop equal to anything else the world will see.
translation.ko: 세상에 당당히 내놓을 만한 물건을 우리 손으로 만든 겁니다

translation.en: [man] Three cheers… Hip-hip hooray!
[singers on radio] ♪ 1540 WADK, Newport ♪
Four minutes before 3:00 on Newport Radio WADK,
translation.ko: 현재 시각 2시 56분 뉴포트 라디오 1983 아메리카 컵 공식 방송을 맡은 WADK입니다

translation.en: the official radio station of the 1983 America's Cup.
translation.ko: 1983 아메리카 컵 공식 방송을 맡은 WADK입니다

translation.en: Speaking of which, the successful 1980 defender, Dennis Conner,
and Liberty, a brand-new 12,
has made her arrival in Newport Harbor today.
[reporter] Dennis Conner, the incumbent America's Cup defender,
a solitary man with a single focus, to win again in 1983.
On behalf of AT&T, we're proud to, uh, be a sponsor
translation.ko: AT&T를 대표하여 아메리카 컵 후원사가 되어

translation.en: in defense of the America's Cup.
And let me just add one other thing. Go get 'em, Dennis!
-[Conner] All right! -[man] Tomorrow!
This Tuesday, they will begin running the competition
for the most coveted sailing prize, the America's Cup.
translation.ko: 아메리카 컵을 두고 화요일부터 대회가 시작됩니다

translation.en: [Lissiman] Now, the America's Cup is a Challenger Series,
52 races against all the other countries,
four-and-a-half months in Newport,
translation.ko: "4위 - 빅토리 83 5위 - 아주라" 4개월 반 동안 52번의 경주를 진행하죠

translation.en: for the right to race against the Americans in September.
translation.ko: "2위 - 캐나다 1호 3위 - 챌린지" 거기서 우승한 팀만 9월에 미국과 붙게 돼요

translation.en: [man] There was a time here in New England
translation.ko: "1983 루이 비통 컵 챌린저 선정 시리즈" 한때 이곳 뉴잉글랜드에서

translation.en: when the words "The British are coming" rang out loud and clear.
translation.ko: '영국군이 온다'라는 말이 울려 퍼지던 때도 있었지만

translation.en: But during this summer of 1983 here in Newport, it's not only the British who are coming,
translation.ko: 1983년 여름 뉴포트에 온 건 비단 영국인뿐만이 아닙니다

translation.en: but it's also the French, the Canadians, the Italians,
and the Australians.
[Longley] When we first got to Newport for the Challenger Races,
translation.ko: 챌린저 시리즈를 위해 뉴포트에 왔을 때

translation.en: we talked about the keel.
And we decided we'd hide it completely.
[Lissiman] The last thing we want to do is show the keel to the world,
translation.ko: 우리가 걱정한 건 용골을 세상에 공개했다가

translation.en: so that someone else could copy it, and put it on their boat,
and be as competitive as what we were.
So, we kept it hidden.
[Longley] And I remember there was a local newspaper.
It said, "The Australians have come with some bizarre, stupid keel."
translation.ko: 호주 팀이 괴상하고 우스꽝스러운 용골을 가져왔다고 하더군요

translation.en: "These guys have finally lost it."
"They've lost three times, and they're getting desperate."
That was the attitude of it.
Starting leg of the America's Cup course is into the wind,
translation.ko: 아메리카 컵의 첫 구간에서 역풍을 가르고 달려

translation.en: four-and-a-half miles long to this mark, followed by two reaching legs.
translation.ko: 이 지점까지 7.2km를 이동한 후 다음 두 구간은 리칭 방향

translation.en: Then the yachts turn one more time to the port,
translation.ko: 그다음 한 번 더 왕복해 항구로 돌아오고

translation.en: finishing once more into the wind.
So we entered the first races of the elimination series against the Italians,
translation.ko: 예선 첫 경기에서 이탈리아 팀과 만났을 땐

translation.en: with the unknown of just how competitive our package was.
translation.ko: 우리도 우리 역량을 파악하지 못하고 있었어요

translation.en: [Simmer] This radical boat, you're either gonna hit a home run or you're not.
translation.ko: 이런 극단적인 배를 타면 결과는 모 아니면 도죠

translation.en: We were either going to be heroes or idiots.
-[official] Five, four, three, two, one. -[gun fires]
[announcer 1] Australia has turned the mark and is absolutely flying downwind.
translation.ko: 지점을 통과한 호주가 쏜살같이 미끄러져 내려갑니다

translation.en: [Bertrand] All the work that we had done in Australia had paid huge dividends.
translation.ko: 호주에서 쏟은 노력들이 큰 성과를 거두었죠

translation.en: [announcer 2] Australia II has won.
[announcer 3] You can see Australia II. She's just crossed the finishing line.
And we came out all guns blazing.
[Longley] We were no longer overawed by Newport.
We were just angry. We were there for one reason, to win.
translation.ko: 대신 흥분하기 시작했어요 목적은 오직 우승이었으니까요

translation.en: The time is 6:30 a.m. on a Sunday morning,
and the Australia II crew is already hard at work.
translation.ko: 호주 선수들은 이미 열심히 훈련 중입니다

translation.en: [Longley] We would run, we'd do weights, we'd do aerobics.
It was not only a part of getting fit and getting strong.
It was also about sending a message.
[all] Good morning, Australia!
[Bertrand] Now it was only until we started to win races
that our credibility increased.
[news anchor 1] In the America's Cup preliminaries,
all signs are pointing to Alan Bond's Australia II as the boat to beat.
translation.ko: 앨런 본드의 오스트레일리아 2호가 최강자로 떠오르는 중입니다

translation.en: [Bertrand] We beat the Italians, crushed the Canadians.
[news anchor 2] After today's race,
it seems nothing can tack faster or point higher into the wind
translation.ko: 벤 렉슨의 급진적인 요트만큼 방향을 빨리 전환하거나

translation.en: than Ben Lexcen's radical 12 Metre.
While few people have actually seen this mysterious keel,
translation.ko: 미스터리한 용골을 직접 본 사람은 얼마 없지만

translation.en: almost everyone here has seen the boat racing and winning.
translation.ko: 호주 배가 승리하는 모습은 수많은 사람들이 목격했습니다

translation.en: [announcer] Australia II, by some…
Then, suddenly, "Why are they so competitive?"
translation.ko: 갑자기 반응이 바뀌었어요 '왜 저렇게 빠른 걸까?'

translation.en: [reporter 1] What is that beneath the hull of the Australia II?
translation.ko: 오스트레일리아 2호 아래에는 도대체 무엇이 있는 걸까요?

translation.en: A keel, but what kind of a keel?
It's this summer's mystery at Newport.
[Bertrand] The boat was covered. It was always secret.
And that started to drive some of the observers crazy.
translation.ko: 그러자 지켜보던 사람들은 애간장을 태우기 시작했죠

translation.en: The big question here, Bryant, this morning, is
what do the Aussies have on their bottom?
[interviewer] Between us, can you tell me what that keel is?
translation.ko: 비밀로 할 테니 용골에 대해 알려줄 수 있나요?

translation.en: -Between us, Mort, I can't tell you, no. -[both laugh]
[reporter 2] Armed guards patrol this place around the clock.
Their job is to protect Australia II,
the yacht that may very well succeed in making sporting history.
[reporter 3] Australia's designer, Ben Lexcen,
he's something of a reluctant superstar here,
but they all want to know about his keel.
-[crowd] Let's see the keel! -[reporter 4] Where's the keel, Benny?
Ben Lexcen decided that he'd draw up a sketch of the winged keel,
translation.ko: 결국 벤 렉슨은 날개 용골을 그리기로 했는데

translation.en: and he made it totally different than what it really was.
translation.ko: 실제 형상과 전혀 다른 모습으로 그렸어요

translation.en: The office at Newport Offshore had a photocopier,
so Ben went over with this sheet of paper and put it on their photocopier.
translation.ko: 벤은 그림을 들고 가서 그 복사기 위에 올려두었죠

translation.en: Comes flying back into the office ten minutes later and says, "Guys!"
"I've left… I've left a drawing of my keel in your photocopier."
translation.ko: '제 용골 그림을 여기 복사기에 두고 갔어요'

translation.en: By that afternoon, there were copies all over Newport of our fake keel.
translation.ko: 그날 오후엔 가짜 용골 그림이 뉴포트에 쫙 깔려 있었죠 "독점! 호외! 비밀 용골 그림 공개"

translation.en: Then opposition boats put winglets on the bottom of their keels.
translation.ko: 상대 팀들이 용골에 작은 날개를 달기 시작했어요

translation.en: [reporter 5] Australia's keel has so impressed everyone
translation.ko: 호주의 용골이 깊은 인상을 남긴 나머지

translation.en: that the British have put wings on the keel of Victory.
translation.ko: 영국 팀은 빅토리의 용골에 날개를 추가했습니다

translation.en: We'd go around and check them and say, "No, it's little a bit different to that."
translation.ko: 우린 구경하며 한마디씩 했죠 '아냐, 우리 거랑 달라'

translation.en: "You gotta try and do it this way." You know? [laughs]
[man] One of the Americans drew that and says there's their design.
translation.ko: 미국인이 그린 그림이에요 이게 벤의 용골이라네요

translation.en: That's their secret keel.
Is that it? What do you think? Is that…
Could be. Could be.
[announcer] Australia II has won!
The West Australians now have an incredible 45 wins from 51 starts,
translation.ko: 서호주 팀은 놀랍게도 51경기 중 45경기에서 승리를 거두며

translation.en: and that just happens to be the best record in 12 Metre history.
And in the end, we won the Challenger Series.
We won by a lot.
And so that's the boat race and the Challenge Series.
translation.ko: 이렇게 오늘 경기와 챌린저 시리즈가 종료됩니다

translation.en: Australia goes on to race Liberty for the America's Cup.
translation.ko: 호주는 아메리카 컵을 두고 리버티와 경기할 예정입니다

translation.en: The Australians are the official 25th challengers for the America's Cup,
translation.ko: 제25회 아메리카 컵의 공식 도전 국가는 호주입니다

translation.en: and their incredible winning record really has the New York Yacht Club worried.
translation.ko: 그들의 놀라운 우승 기록 때문에 미국 팀은 걱정에 빠졌습니다

translation.en: [reporter] The man who won the Cup last time for the United States is jittery.
translation.ko: 미국을 우승으로 이끌었던 선장이 초조해 보입니다

translation.en: We don't know much about their boat. It's obviously a different, uh, type
translation.ko: 배에 대해 알려진 게 없어요 일반적인 12m 요트와는

translation.en: of, uh, characteristics than a standard 12 Metre.
translation.ko: 배에 대해 알려진 게 없어요 일반적인 12m 요트와는 다른 특징을 지녔다는 건 확실하죠

translation.en: It tacks differently, and it, uh, accelerates differently,
translation.ko: 태킹 방식도 가속 방식도 전혀 다르고

translation.en: and it maneuvers differently at the starts.
translation.ko: 태킹 방식도 가속 방식도 전혀 다르고 출발할 때 움직임도 다릅니다

translation.en: The New York Yacht Club saw that our race record was really strong.
translation.ko: 미국은 우리의 경기 활약을 의식하고 있었어요

translation.en: -Hi. -[reporter] Two minutes for a--
-No. Sorry. -[reporter] Not even two minutes?
We're late for a meeting here, so we gotta move on.
translation.ko: 회의 시간에 늦어서 어서 가봐야 하거든요

translation.en: Thank you anyway.
[Bertrand] And if these Aussies are beating up on the foreign challengers so easily,
translation.ko: 불쑥 나타난 호주 팀이 다른 챌린저들을 쉽게 이기고

translation.en: 47 wins out of 55 races,
then that starts to cut deep.
That sent shock waves through the New York Yacht Club.
Clearly shock waves through Newport.
[reporter 1] There's a serious side to this.
Obviously there's more than just a yachting race at stake.
There's also a lot of money.
It's estimated that £100 million are spent in and around Newport
translation.ko: 아메리카 컵 기간에 뉴포트에서 소비되는 돈은

translation.en: during the America's Cup.
It was a sudden realization that they could lose this golden goose.
translation.ko: 황금알을 낳는 거위를 잃을지도 모른다는 현실이

translation.en: It could really happen.
[man] People in Newport and Rhode Island knew all the time,
but kept it a very closely guarded secret that the prize isn't so much a sailboat race.
translation.ko: 진정한 상이 아니라는 사실을 그동안 비밀로 지켜왔습니다

translation.en: It's about a billion-dollar industry that goes along with the Cup.
translation.ko: 진짜 상은 개최지가 누리는 10억 달러어치의 경제 효과죠

translation.en: [reporter 2] So if the Americans lose,
then a substantial amount of that might be spent in Western Australia.
translation.ko: 다음부터 그 돈의 대부분이 서호주에서 사용될 겁니다

translation.en: [Bertrand] So, for the New York Yacht Club,
the consequences of losing
are enormous.
[announcer] An ABC News Brief brought to you by Apple Computer.
translation.ko: 애플 컴퓨터 제공 ABC 토막 뉴스입니다

translation.en: Now from Los Angeles, here's Peter Jennings.
The America's Cup competition is set to get underway this Thursday.
translation.ko: 아메리카 컵 대회가 이번 목요일에 열립니다

translation.en: There is now a dispute, however,
between the New York Yacht Club and the Australians.
translation.ko: 뉴욕 요트 클럽 사이에 분쟁이 발생했는데요

translation.en: It seems the Americans are upset with something the Aussies have done with the underside of their boat,
translation.ko: 미국 팀은 호주 요트 하부에 대해 불만을 제기한 것으로 보입니다

translation.en: something the Americans feel will give the Aussies an unfair advantage.
translation.ko: 따라서 호주가 부당한 이점을 누린다고 주장하는 것이죠

translation.en: The New York Yacht Club alleges that Australia II's winged keel is illegal.
translation.ko: 뉴욕 요트 클럽은 호주 팀 용골의 규정 위반을 주장합니다

translation.en: This four-million-dollar challenge,
the closest ever in the history of the Cup, could be scuttled.
[Longley] The New York Yacht Club, they wanted to ban us.
translation.ko: 뉴욕 요트 클럽은 출전 자격을 정지하려 했어요

translation.en: They said there is no way that Benny could've come up with this.
translation.ko: 용골 설계를 베니가 혼자 했을 리 없고

translation.en: It had to have been designed by other people.
People couldn't believe that he could do it,
given his education and his background.
[reporter 1] At the center of all the fuss this year has been barefoot Ben Lexcen.
translation.ko: 올해 논란의 중심에 선 이는 맨발의 벤 렉슨입니다

translation.en: With three years' schooling,
he's the man who has designed, arguably, the fastest 12 Metre ever.
translation.ko: 역사상 가장 빠른 12m 배를 설계한 인물이죠

translation.en: [Conner] I didn't know much about Ben Lexcen.
But people talk.
You hear through the grapevine.
Who's to say these wings, whose idea these really were?
translation.ko: 그 날개가 렉슨의 생각이라는 증거도 없고요

translation.en: [reporter 2] The Americans try and confirm that Lexcen was helped by Dutch designers.
translation.ko: 미국 팀은 네덜란드 설계자들이 렉슨을 도왔다고 주장합니다

translation.en: [Conner] We believe Lexcen used the idea from Amsterdam,
translation.ko: 우린 렉슨이 암스테르담에서 도움을 받았다고 생각했어요

translation.en: but the rules are it had to be designed by the country of the challenge.
translation.ko: "네덜란드와 호주의 협업으로 혼선 초래" 하지만 도전 팀의 요트는 자국에서 설계하는 게 규정이죠

translation.en: The New York Yacht Club believe they have grounds to say
translation.ko: 뉴욕 요트 클럽은 제가 요트의 설계를

translation.en: that I didn't design the boat totally by myself.
They go behind your back and try and get evidence in dubious ways.
translation.ko: 우리 뒤를 캐며 수상한 방법으로 증거물을 수집하려 하죠

translation.en: [reporter 3] This afternoon, Ben was suffering
what friends said were a couple of dizzy spells.
translation.ko: 벤이 여러 번 어지럼증을 호소했다고 밝혔습니다

translation.en: Doctors immediately put him into intensive care.
translation.ko: 의사들은 벤을 즉시 집중 치료실로 옮겼는데요

translation.en: His friends say it's the attacks against his name that helped put him there.
translation.ko: 동료들은 벤을 향한 모함이 그 원인이라고 밝혔습니다

translation.en: [Bertrand] The New York Yacht Club were endeavoring to get the design assistants in Holland
translation.ko: 뉴욕 요트 클럽은 벤 렉슨이 아닌 네덜란드 설계자들이

translation.en: to say that they designed the keel and not Ben Lexcen.
The Dutch had designed the keel and not Ben Lexcen.
translation.ko: 용골은 벤 렉슨이 아닌 네덜란드의 작품입니다 "뉴욕 요트 클럽 제독"

translation.en: We felt responsible to go over,
translation.ko: "뉴욕 요트 클럽 제독" 네덜란드에 사람을 보내 조사해야겠다고 판단했습니다

translation.en: to send someone to Holland to really investigate it.
[reporter] The director of the Netherlands Ship Model Basin has charged
that members of the New York Yacht Club tried to get him to sign a false affidavit
translation.ko: 렉슨이 설계자가 아니라는 내용의 거짓 진술 서명을 강요받았다며

translation.en: stating Ben Lexcen was not the designer.
[Van Oossanen] I was very surprised to come face-to-face with two people
who wanted me to sign a document
translation.ko: 오스트레일리아 2호의 설계자가 "네덜란드 설계자 페터르 판오사넌 음성"

translation.en: which said that I was the designer of Australia II rather than Ben Lexcen,
translation.ko: "네덜란드 설계자 페터르 판오사넌 음성" 벤 렉슨이 아닌 저라는 문서에 서명하길 요구하더군요

translation.en: which is almost too ridiculous to even think of.
translation.ko: 상상조차 할 수 없는 어처구니없는 주장이죠

translation.en: The keel cup committee said, "We've been over to Holland,
and there was no substance to their complaint."
"This boat is fair and legal."
And that was the thing that finally busted their case apart.
The New York Yacht Club today withdrew its objections
translation.ko: 오늘 뉴욕 요트 클럽은 오스트레일리아 2호에 부착된

translation.en: to the mysterious winged keel on Australia II
translation.ko: 날개형 용골에 대한 이의 제기를 철회하며

translation.en: and said, "May the better yacht win the America's Cup."
[Bond] It has been 56 races and nearly two and a half years of effort
translation.ko: 우린 2년 반에 걸친 준비와 56번의 경기를 통해

translation.en: been put in to reach where we are today.
translation.ko: 우린 2년 반에 걸친 준비와 56번의 경기를 통해 오늘 이 자리에 섰습니다

translation.en: Let the best yacht and crew decide by the gun at the end of each race.

translation.ko: 준비 과정에만 수천 시간 아니, 일생이 들어갔어요

translation.en: And I'd visualized this space. I'd visualized this time.
translation.ko: 그 시간, 그 장소를 오래전부터 상상해 왔었죠

translation.en: I said to the team,
"Visualize you're on the back of an eagle, a thousand feet in the air."
translation.ko: '하늘을 나는 독수리 등에 올라타 있다고 생각해 봐'

translation.en: "And you see the boat going through the water."
So I said, "Reach down with big scissors and cut the distractions,
translation.ko: '큰 가위를 들고 내려가서 방해 요소를 전부 잘라버려'

translation.en: release the boat, release ourselves."
"There's no tomorrow, there's no yesterday, and there's no future."
translation.ko: '내일도 없고, 어제도 없었고 미래는 존재하지 않아'

translation.en: It was just today.
[commentator 1] Five seconds away from the start.
-[gun fires] -[commentator 1] There's the starting gun.
When the gun went off, the two boats charged at each other.
translation.ko: 총성이 울리자 두 배가 엎치락뒤치락 뛰쳐나갔어요

translation.en: Here we go, you know. This is gonna be on.
[commentator 2] They are neck-and-neck at the moment.
John Bertrand has now turned towards Liberty.
translation.ko: 이제 존 버트런드가 리버티를 향해 회전합니다

translation.en: We actually had a good start, and when we tacked, we were in front.
translation.ko: 시작은 좋았어요 태킹 후에는 앞서 있었죠

translation.en: [commentator 3] Australia's gone right on top of Liberty by about two boat lengths.
Both boats on starboard tack.
[commentator 4] Uh-oh! It looks like John Bertrand has decided not to cover Dennis Conner.
translation.ko: 저런, 존 버트런드가 데니스 코너를 보내주는데요?

translation.en: [Longley] But Dennis gets in front
and, quite frankly, starts to sail away from us.
It became clear that Liberty was actually a faster boat than what we'd seen before.
translation.ko: 리버티는 우리가 알던 것보다 더 빠른 배로 변해 있었어요

translation.en: The boat had been revved up.
[Mundle] The boat is gaining maximum speed
moving very nicely through the water there.
[commentator 5] She certainly looks like a different boat
and obviously she's sailing like a different boat today.
[commentator 6] You can see the two yachts are now approaching the first marker,
translation.ko: 보시다시피 두 요트가 첫 지점을 향해 가고 있는데요

translation.en: and it's not good news for Australia.
[Mundle] Liberty is leading by 29 seconds at the first mark.
[commentator 6] That failure by John Bertrand to recover could be tragic.
We did everything we could, but they just went faster.
translation.ko: 할 수 있는 건 다 했는데 그 팀이 더 빠르더라고요

translation.en: [news anchor] If you're just joining us, it has been Liberty all the way.
translation.ko: 경기 내용을 말씀드리자면 줄곧 리버티가 앞섰습니다

translation.en: At the second mark, it was Liberty by 45. At the third mark, Liberty by 23.
[Bertrand] They just swept away from us. Close to a minute in front of us.
We just couldn't believe it.
[Mundle] We're just watching Liberty having rounded the fourth mark on the course,
the margin around 55 seconds, Bob.
The Cup is as good as lost.
It seems that Bertrand's errors early in the race
translation.ko: 경기 초반에 있었던 버트런드의 실착으로 인해

translation.en: may have cost Australia II the America's Cup.
To get 58 seconds ahead, that…
that's a long way.
Four thousand people gathered outside
translation.ko: 관중 4천 명이 서호주 로열 퍼스 요트 클럽에 모여 있다고 합니다

translation.en: the Royal Perth Yacht Club in Western Australia,
translation.ko: 서호주 로열 퍼스 요트 클럽에 모여 있다고 합니다

translation.en: watching our live pictures and, uh, similar scenes over in Sydney.
translation.ko: 모두 생중계를 시청 중이고 시드니 시민들도 마찬가지인데요

translation.en: [announcer] It appears Liberty has a healthy lead at this point.
translation.ko: 리버티가 격차를 충분히 벌려둔 것 같습니다

translation.en: It's a race Dennis Conner cannot lose.
translation.ko: 데니스 코너가 포기할 리 없는 경기죠

translation.en: [reporter] The tension mounts at the Bertrand household.
Mrs. Bertrand experiences the agony
of watching The Wonder from Down Under fall behind the American yacht, Liberty.
translation.ko: 점점 뒤처지는 호주의 자랑을 지켜보고 있습니다

translation.en: And, gentlemen, this downwind run is possibly our last hope.
translation.ko: 여러분, 이번 순풍 구간이 마지막 기회로 보입니다

translation.en: [Bertrand] They were basically gone.
But the bottom line is,
if the opposition start to believe that the competition
translation.ko: 상대 팀의 실력과 상대 팀이 탄 배가

translation.en: and the equipment that they're using is superior,
and you can't do anything about it 'cause it's secret,
translation.ko: 그리고 그 비법이 비밀이라 대처 방법이 없다면

translation.en: that becomes, psychologically, a big hurdle to overcome.
And ultimately, Dennis made a decision
that was a mistake.
[Mundle] Dennis Conner's come to the right-hand side of the course,
looking for a big wind shift which he hopes will be over here.
translation.ko: 바람의 급변을 예상하고 내린 결정일 텐데요

translation.en: We get to the top marker, and Dennis, he tacks way out.
translation.ko: 마지막 지점을 앞두고 데니스가 항로에서 과하게 빠지더군요

translation.en: [commentator] This is an unusual move.
Dennis has decided not to cover John Bertrand.
translation.ko: 데니스는 존 버트런드를 막아설 생각이 없습니다

translation.en: [Treharne] He went to the right-hand side of the course,
and that surprised me.
And I remember just looking at the clouds evolving.
translation.ko: 그때 전 구름의 움직임을 살피고 있었어요

translation.en: I could start to see the wind on water.
Darker patches and lighter patches. I could see the direction of the wind.
translation.ko: 짙은 물과 옅은 물을 보며 풍향을 가늠할 수 있거든요

translation.en: And then, eventually, you start to get a sixth sense of what the wind is gonna do.
translation.ko: 그러면 어느 순간부터 직감으로 바람의 움직임을 예상할 수 있어요

translation.en: Not now, but within the next 10, 15 and 20 seconds,
which is the game.
Trim.
And as we keep going to the left, the breeze starts going left.
translation.ko: 우리가 좌측으로 움직이니까 바람도 따라 불기 시작했어요

translation.en: Here we go.
And we started to make gains on Liberty, with extra wind.
translation.ko: 그렇게 바람의 도움을 받아 리버티와의 격차를 줄여 나갔어요

translation.en: [Mundle] As they head off there,
you can see crewmen winding those coffee grinder winches,
translation.ko: 선원들이 커피 그라인더 모양의 윈치를 힘껏 돌리며

translation.en: trying to keep the yacht at maximum speed.
[man] It's going to be a mammoth effort if she should do it.
It was meter by meter. It was yard by yard. It was wind shift by wind shift.
translation.ko: 바람이 불 때마다 1m씩 나아가며 거리를 꿋꿋이 좁혔어요

translation.en: [Mundle] There you see Australia II coming back right now towards Liberty.
This race is a hot one.
Only a matter of minutes ago, the America's Cup was as good as lost.
translation.ko: 불과 몇 분 전만 해도 승산이 전혀 없었는데 말이죠

translation.en: Gentlemen, it's neck and neck,
but perhaps Liberty just fractionally in front.
translation.ko: 리버티가 한 뼘만큼 앞선 것으로 보이는데요

translation.en: [Mundle] So Australia II is back in the race.
[Longley] And then, of course, they jibed and came across.
translation.ko: 결국 리버티도 자이빙을 해서 우리 쪽으로 돌아왔고

translation.en: The whole of the world, who's watching this, is holding their breath.
translation.ko: 전 세계가 숨을 참고 그 광경을 지켜보고 있었어요

translation.en: [Mundle] The tension at the moment is absolutely electric out there.
translation.ko: 팽팽한 긴장감으로 두 팀 사이에 불꽃이 튀는 것만 같군요

translation.en: Australia II's decided to come back and attack.
[Longley] It's not easy, particularly from a helicopter shot,
to see who's in front.
What'll happen with the cross?
And we went from 57 seconds behind to bow on bow.
translation.ko: 57초 뒤처졌던 배가 상대와 나란히 달리고 있었죠

translation.en: I made the decision to jibe on top of them, which was high risk.
translation.ko: 위험을 감수하고 리버티 앞으로 자이빙을 하기로 결정했어요

translation.en: [Mundle] A collision course at the moment.
-Looks like Australia II will go across. -[man] A gutsy move.
[Mundle] An unbelievable move to come across there now.
We went across their bow, and we're in front.
translation.ko: 리버티의 선수를 지나쳐서 그 앞을 차지했어요

translation.en: [Mundle] It looks like Australia II is back in front.
-Absolutely incredible. -[crowd cheering]
[reporter] There's about 2,000 people here packing Royal Perth Yacht Club,
translation.ko: 로열 퍼스 요트 클럽에 모인 2천 명의 관중들도

translation.en: and they are absolutely rooting for Australia II.
I've never ever seen anything like this.
There was mass disappointment here before.
In the past leg, it's been absolute mayhem in here.
translation.ko: 방금 구간을 지켜보며 실망이 환호로 바뀌었습니다!

translation.en: [Mundle] And now it's all on.
An absolute drag race to the finish. Do you believe this, Bob Lobel?
translation.ko: 결승선까지 드래그 레이스죠 밥 로벨, 믿기십니까?

translation.en: [Lobel] I've seen a lot of things, but never anything like this.
Go, go, go!
[Bertrand] On that particular leg of the course,
we probably sailed the boat as best we'd ever sailed.
We were closer to perfection than any time I'd ever been.
translation.ko: 아마도 그동안의 항해 중에서 가장 완벽에 가까웠을 겁니다

translation.en: This group became so close and so tight.
translation.ko: 선원들이 워낙 끈끈하고 호흡이 잘 맞아서

translation.en: It was basically almost on autopilot.
We were sailing into history.
[Mundle] We're looking for the smoke at any moment.
They're about to do it. They're about to cross the line.
translation.ko: 드디어 그 순간입니다! 결승선이 눈앞에 있습니다!

translation.en: They make a final move. It's over!
[Mundle] Australia II has done it!
They have won the America's Cup!
Will you stand up, Australia? Will you stand up and cheer?
translation.ko: 호주 국민 여러분 모두 일어나서 기뻐하십시오

translation.en: Because this is the finest day in the history of Australian sport.
translation.ko: 오늘은 호주 스포츠 역사상 가장 찬란한 날입니다

translation.en: John Bertrand, the skipper,
and all of those men out there on that boat,
they have written their name large in Australian history.
translation.ko: 자신들의 이름을 호주 역사에 크게 새겼습니다

translation.en: They have won the America's Cup.
[Bob Hawke] While I was Prime Minister,
I said some very wise and important things,
translation.ko: 현명한 말도 많이 하고 중요한 말도 많이 했지만

translation.en: but I don't think anything I've ever said
is as well remembered as when I said…
I tell you what, any boss who sacks anyone for not turning up today is a bum!
translation.ko: 오늘 결근했다고 해고하는 사장 있으면 모지리예요

translation.en: Here we go!
Across Australia, people are doing this, saluting the men of Australia II with champagne.
translation.ko: 오스트레일리아 2호 선원들을 위해 전국에서 바치는 건배입니다

translation.en: And boys, they really deserve it.
[Simmer] I remember just going, "Shit," that it had happened.
translation.ko: 우리가 저지른 일을 보고 넋이 나가 있었어요

translation.en: Really remember John just kind of literally slumped over the wheel.
translation.ko: 그리고 존은 조타기 위에 힘없이 앉아 있었죠

translation.en: Just like everything just draining out of him.
It was this relief to actually win it on behalf of your country.
That's, uh, that's huge.
So… [clears throat] …how do you rationalize that?
translation.ko: 그 기분을 어찌 말로 표현할 수 있겠어요?

translation.en: [Treharne] It was quite something
that I never thought could happen or would happen.
translation.ko: 일어날 수도 없고 일어나지 않을 줄 알았어요

translation.en: But it did.
It's a pretty powerful thing for me to be feeling like I do now. [chuckles]
translation.ko: 지금도 그때 느낀 기분이 강렬히 느껴지네요

translation.en: So long ago.
Must have affected me more than I thought it did. [sniffles]
translation.ko: 제게 생각보다 큰 여운을 남겼나 봐요

translation.en: Anyway. [coughs]
Everyone went nuts. [chuckles]
[Longley] We lifted our heads up,
and there are boats coming from everywhere.
Boats all around us, you know?
And this cacophony of noise.
[announcer] Ah! This is the greatest moment ever!
I thought we were history, history the beginning of the week.
translation.ko: 난 우리가 끝장난 줄 알았거든! 며칠 전만 해도 나락이었는데 죽음에서 살아 돌아왔어!

translation.en: From the jaws of death. [laughs]
translation.ko: 며칠 전만 해도 나락이었는데 죽음에서 살아 돌아왔어!

translation.en: [Brown] When we were getting towed in, we hoisted the Australian flag,
translation.ko: 항구로 돌아가는 길에 국기를 매달아 올렸어요

translation.en: and that was a really proud moment, that we'd done something pretty special.
translation.ko: 특별한 목표를 성취했다는 뿌듯함이 느껴지는 순간이었죠

translation.en: [commentator] And this is just such a tremendously festive scene,
the sun now perched on the horizon
as Australia II makes her way back into Newport Harbor,
the first challenger ever to win the America's Cup.
translation.ko: 아메리카 컵에서 우승한 최초의 도전 팀입니다

translation.en: It is a mob scene here on the dock of Australia II.
The Australians have finally done it.
And I remember pulling the boat out of the water,
and Bondy like a conductor.
[all chanting] Let's see the keel!
[reporter 1] There's a very happy Alan Bond.
He's gonna take it up without the curtains. The keel is gonna be seen.
translation.ko: 장막 없이 배를 건져서 용골을 보여줄 생각이네요

translation.en: Get her up, Australia II, and the skirt comes off.
Everyone saw the winged keel for the first time.
[reporter 2] It's a brilliant piece of engineering design work,
translation.ko: 기술 설계 분야의 역작이라 할 수 있습니다

translation.en: extremely creative.
[Mundle] Ben Lexcen, designer of Australia II, the man who did it.
He has achieved his life's ambition.
There, believe it or not,
Dennis Conner wearing his New York Yacht Club hat.
translation.ko: 뉴욕 요트 클럽 모자를 쓴 데니스 코너도 보입니다

translation.en: [Bertrand] Dennis congratulated me.
Not a lot of words said, but it was warrior to warrior.
translation.ko: 짧은 몇 마디였지만 두 전사의 대화였죠

translation.en: There's no question about it.
[Mundle] I think Dennis does look a little bit stunned there, David.
translation.ko: 데니스의 표정을 보니 충격을 받은 듯합니다

translation.en: [Simmer] I remember shaking hands with him, and he had tears in his eyes.
Yeah, he took it hard, hard, really hard.
Yeah.
It was a totally devastating… loss.
When I came in after losing the Cup, they have a press conference,
and nobody from the New York Yacht Club shows up to sit with you,
translation.ko: 뉴욕 요트 클럽 사람은 한 명도 안 왔더라고요

translation.en: you got the idea they don't like you very much anymore.
translation.ko: 이제 날 싫어한다는 걸 바로 알 수 있었죠

translation.en: I'm sure they were understandably disappointed.
You know, they were just as devastated as I was in losing the Cup.
translation.ko: 트로피를 빼앗겼다는 사실에 나만큼 속상했을 테니까요

translation.en: Today, Australia II was just a better boat,
and they beat us, and we have no excuses.
So I'd like to, uh, at this point, congratulate Alan Bond and Australia II.
translation.ko: 그래서 앨런 본드와 선수들에게 축하의 말씀을 전하고 싶습니다

translation.en: They proved that they were an outstanding boat.
translation.ko: 더 훌륭한 배를 가졌다는 걸 증명한 여러분이

translation.en: And today was their day.
[reporter] It was Dennis Conner's last appearance as America's Cup skipper,
translation.ko: 아메리카 컵 선장으로서는 마지막 장면이 될 겁니다

translation.en: a great performer bowing out a loser with tears in his eyes
translation.ko: 멋진 모습을 보여주었지만 패배의 눈물, 모자 인사와 함께

translation.en: and a whirl of his hat.
John Bertrand and his crew have done a fine job today,
and I'm so pleased that we can say not goodbye to Newport,
translation.ko: 무척 기쁜 마음으로 뉴포트에 작별 인사를 하는 대신

translation.en: but an open invitation to the people of Newport
and the people of America to come to Perth in Western Australia
translation.ko: 이제 미국분들이 서호주 퍼스로 오시면 됩니다

translation.en: and try and win it back.
We welcome you.
[Bertrand] When we actually were presented with the America's Cup…
when I lifted the trophy above my head,
it was a boyhood dream becoming reality.
It was a big deal to beat America at something that America had been so dominant.
translation.ko: 미국이 지배하는 종목에서 미국을 이기는 업적을 세웠죠

translation.en: So this little country, suddenly it was on the world stage.
translation.ko: 그래서 우리 작은 나라가 세계의 주목을 받게 됐어요

translation.en: [Ronald Reagan] Skipper John Bertrand, you and the crew of the Australia II
have shown us the stuff of which Australians are made.
I know your countrymen are proud of you, and I want you to take this message back,
translation.ko: 여러분은 호주의 자랑이시지만 제가 드리고 싶은 말씀은

translation.en: that Americans are proud too.
We're proud to have Australians as our very dear friends.
[Longley] When we got back to Australia,
they'd said we're gonna do a street parade from Fremantle to Perth, which is--
translation.ko: "호주는 할 수 있다" 프리맨틀에서 퍼스까지 거리 행진을 한다더군요, 거리가…

translation.en: -Twenty-two kilometers. -Twenty-two kilometers to be precise.
I said, "We're gonna look like idiots driving down Stirling Highway
with three people and a dog waving at ya."
translation.ko: '사람 셋에 개 한 마리쯤 나와 있으려나?' "데니스, 도전해 보시든가"

translation.en: Well, the street was lined the whole 22 kilometers.
translation.ko: 그런데 행진 시작점부터 끝까지 사람들이 줄지어 서 있었어요

translation.en: [Longley] When we got to Perth,
there were 250,000 people there to welcome us.
We're such a small nation going against such large odds.
translation.ko: "세계보다 41초 빠른 호주" 크지 않은 나라지만 쉽지 않은 일을 해냈습니다

translation.en: But it was that terrific determination
of the people of Australia and all the guys.
[Conner] After losing the Cup, I had no money.
I was a carpet salesman.
[Conner] I was certainly depressed.
But when I saw 21 different countries challenging for the Cup in Perth,
maybe I should quit feeling sorry for myself
and see what I could do about winning it back.
[reporter] Today, in San Diego, California,
Dennis Conner announced his comeback for the 1987 America's Cup.
translation.ko: 데니스 코너가 1987 아메리카 컵 복귀 소식을 알렸습니다

translation.en: However, he will not be facing the skipper who wrenched away the trophy in 1983.
translation.ko: 그러나 83년에 트로피를 앗아 갔던 선장과는 만날 수 없게 됐습니다

translation.en: [man] Why aren't you in it this year?
The fire's out of my belly,
and content people don't become world champions.
translation.ko: 현재에 만족하는 사람은 챔피언이 될 수 없는데

translation.en: I'm content in that part of my life,
and I'm really keen and excited to move out into new directions.
That's what I'm doing.
[Bertrand] But for Dennis and coming back,
it was an opportunity to resurrect himself.
♪ Come back to the shore ♪ ♪ I realize something… ♪
[announcer 1] There's the gun. Stars & Stripes has done it.
They've won the America's Cup.
[announcer 2] He has climbed yachting's Mount Everest,
and he has captured, once again, yachting's holy grail.
[announcer 1] Revenge for Dennis Conner.
